content.description:
Start feet first out the large roof on two opposing slopers.  Climb out to the fin, match, and pull the lip on small crimps.  No real fingery moves on this one, mostly just core strength to stay on the roof and avoid dabbing. 

  With the right beta this will probably feel pretty easy for the grade, or maybe it is easy for the grade.
content.protection: Pad, watch the opposing wall at the finish
content.location: From the start of the area head straight back through boulders (south) and arrive at a deep well chalked roof.

content.description: Climbs the scoop left of Stegasaur. Start sitting in the back and stem like crazy to gain the lip and do some wicked jive to exit

Facing Stegasaurus, this problem is directly behind you. There is a short crack problem (v2?) and a small low roof to the left under the boulder. This problem starts under this roof to the left and makes a lowball roof climb to join into the crack problem to finish. Start deep in the roof left on poor holds following cool holds and moves right. Original beta invloved a full 360 rotation to make use the holds. May be harder than v8? Very cool moves on super nice rock but a butt dragger. Takes away some of the appeal.
Sit start on left hand hueco pocket and right hand edge. Make moves up to shallow dish and huck for the jug.
content.location: North of the chains in the opening of the cave that leads to the new meadow. MOUSIE ADAME will be tagged in the middle of the climb.

content.description: start low in hole to the right on decent-ish crimps, bust out left to sloper, go up.
content.location: a more obscure line for north, but pretty easy to find, its just before mousie adame/ new meadow entrance. scramble up a boulder or two and drop down into the first pit you see

content.description: Very slopey traverse next to the Mousie Adame problem. On the block that forms the left side of beginning on the entrance going to the New Meadow. Sit start on the right hand side of the block, two moves up and then traverse left following tenuous slopers leading around the corner of the boulder finishing on edges up and left.
content.location: On the block just right of the Mousie Adame. This boulder forms the left side of the entrance going in to the New Meadow. This problem starts low and right sitting and moves to the left around the corner and up the face.

content.description: SDS start on sloper, bump right to gaston, finish up slopers and top left.
content.location: If you head up the chains from the east lot, it's straight and to the right tucked back in the shade.

content.description: Small area between The Small Potatoes and the entrance to The New Meadow.  Consists of easier highballs with a few hard problems.  The centerpieces of the area are Stegasaur a V8 roof and Mousie Adame a one move V7.
